Name: Falling Leaf Aesi

Interrupts.Name: Steal Ability
Interrupts.Trigger: A foe in range 2 uses an ability and the ability resolves.
Interrupts.Effects: The foe loses the memory of that ability, becoming unable to use it until they pick up a memory.

Actions.Name: Swirling Leaves
Actions.Description: At the start of each round, the Aesi puts down a space of swirling wind, a 1 space terrain effect, adjacent to its space. Characters that enter such a space, including the Aesi, can fly 3 spaces as an effect, but only once a turn. Spaces persist until the end of combat.

Actions.Name: Greenpath
Actions.Description: Remove the Aesi from play, then place them anywhere on the battlefield in free space. Clear all statuses from them.

Actions.Name: Wall of Thorns
Actions.Description: The Aesi creates a line 3 area of height 1 thorny wall objects. Each object is destructible (5 hp) and also considered dangerous terrain, but only for foes. Foes that collide with it take 2 piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Fae Thief
Actions.Description: The Aesi steals something from a foe in range 5, marking them. Roll 1d6 to see what. Picking up a memory ends this effect. Re-roll repeat effects.

Rolls.Name: Friendship
Rolls.Description: Foes abilities can't target allies and treat all allies as immune to their effects, including any active marks, stances, auras, etc.

Rolls.Name: Luck
Rolls.Description: Foe makes all attacks and saves with +1 curse, cannot gain boons, and cannot critical hit.

Rolls.Name: Heart
Rolls.Description: Foe cannot gain vigor or benefit from defiance.

Rolls.Name: Grace
Rolls.Description: Aesi cannot miss this foe with attacks, and they cannot reduce damage from the Aesi in any way.

Rolls.Name: Youth
Rolls.Description: Foe cannot dash and is dazed+.

Actions.Name: Leaf Dance
Actions.Effects: Aesi may dash 2 spaces before this attack.

Combo.Name: Cutting Wit
Combo.Effects: All foes are dazed. Shove all memories outside of the area.

Combo.Name: Artery Cut
Combo.Effects: Attack target is marked and gains an open wound. While marked, it takes [D] again at the end of its turns. This mark ends instead if the character ends their turn adjacent to an ally.

Actions.Name: Gust Strike
Actions.Description: The Aesi flies exactly 3 spaces in a straight line, dealing 2 damage to all foes it passes over. If it lands on an object height 1 or higher, it may repeat this effect, but only once a turn, and may only damage foes once per use of this ability.

Actions.Name: Whirling Branches
Actions.Effects: Teleport 1, then deal 1 damage to all adjacent foes and shove all adjacent foes and memories 1. Repeat this effect three times.

PhasesDescription: At the start of round 3, and every two rounds thereafter (5, 7, etc), the Aesi uses Mortal Mockery.

Actions.Name: Mortal Mockery
Actions.Description:
The Aesi transforms its physical form into a mockery of the closest foe. The effects depend on the foe's class. If the same effect would be chosen twice, the Aesi can choose a different one of its choice to apply.
Naturally, all of these effects stack if the Aesi is allowed to use them again. Why be one class when you can be all of them?

ListedItems.Name: Mock Stalwart
ListedItems.Description: The Aesi gains armor 2 and rampart. In addition, Leaf dance and Cutting Wit gain true strike.

ListedItems.Name: Mock Vagabond
ListedItems.Description: The Aesi may split up all its movement with actions. In addition, Leaf dance and Cutting Wit gain unerring and the ability to critically hit, dealing +[D] on a crit.

ListedItems.Name: Mock Mendicant
ListedItems.Description: The Aesi gains regeneration. In addition, Leaf Dance and Cutting Wit deal bonus damage.

ListedItems.Name: Mock Wright
ListedItems.Description: The Aesi gains the Aetherwall trait. In addition, Leaf Dance and Cutting Wit gain pierce.

Tactics: Characters fighting this Aesi will find themselves scrambling to recover memories as they have their abilities quite literally blown out of them. The Aesi can make this difficult by knocking memories around, isolating them with Wall of Thorns, and forcing them to group up with Artery Cut. In phase II, characters must make quick work of the Aesi, or find themselves overwhelmed.
